duck: Spindle (textiles) - A spindle is a straight spike usually made from wood used for spinning, twisting fibers such as wool, flax, hemp, cotton into yarn.
distaff definition: a staff for holding the flax, tow, or wool in spinning.
Distaff Day - Distaff Day, also called Roc Day, is 7 January, the day after the feast of the Epiphany.
As a noun, a distaff (also called a rock) is a tool used in spinning.

wiki.text:
instructing girls to spin flax on spindles using distaffs, Albert Anker, 1888]]

As a noun, a 'distaff' (, also called a 'rock'<ref name="OED">"Rock." The Oxford
English Dictionay. 2nd ed. 1989.</ref>) is a tool used in spinning. It is
designed to hold the unspun fibers, keeping them untangled and thus easing the
spinning process. It is most commonly used to hold flax, and sometimes wool, but
can be used for any type of fiber. Fiber is wrapped around the distaff, and tied
in place with a piece of ribbon or string. The word comes from dis in Low
German, meaning a bunch of flax, connected with staff. As an adjective the term
distaff is used to describe the female side of a family.
wiki.title: distaff
